intro: Gnaphalium recurvatum, commonly known as the bent-stemmed everlasting flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, showy composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while the stems are often curved or bent, giving it its common name. The flowers are often used in floral arrangements due to their long-lasting nature and delicate appearance.
